resources.string: The Archelon is a species of extinct sea turtle known for being the largest of its kind ever documented. Contrary to most sea turtles, the Archelon had a leathery shell, along with a pointed tail and narrow skull. Its diet minly consisted of mollusks, such as squid.

The Florida Cave Bear weighed about 650 pounds, roughly the size of a modern-day brown bear. It is characterized by a dome shaped skull and a very steep forehead. Its teeth are thought to have done more damage than other species\'. The Cave Bear went extinct around 8,000 years ago.

The Casteroide is an ancient species of beaver known for being the largest beaver to ever exist. The creature is characterized by its large, broad inscisors, and would remain underwater for extended periods of time. The extinction of the Casteroide was most likely caused by widespread ecological restructuring.
Modern elephants are the last surviving descendants of a common ancestor that split and evolved into other species, such as the Woolly Mammoth and Dugong.
Ancient three-toed horses were commonly found in Florida and were about the size of a dog. Most resided either in forests or prairies. Many fossils can still be found today.

The Mastodon was a prehistoric elephant known for their low shoulders and string tusks. Their diet primarily consisted of leaves and berries, but could also be found grazing. The Mastodon went extinct due to a mass extinction between eras.

The Megalodon lived around 15.9-2.6 million years ago. These huge sharks were one of the largest predators in history, growing up to 50 feet long and weighing 114 tons. They were carnivores with very large teeth, and the name Megalodon lterally means "big tooth".

The Megatherium was a giant sloth, and at 20 feet tall was one of the largest mammals in history. They were herbivores, using their large claws to strip leaves and bark. The Megatherium went extinct around 10,000 years ago due to human hunting and rapid climate change.

The Phorusrhacidae was large flightless bird that existed from 62 million to 2.5 million years ago. They were carnivores, and their extinction was most likely due to increasing competition from other carnivores.

The Saber Toothed Tiger was ferocious prehistoric cat, whose canine teeth grew up to 12 inches and whose mouth could openup to 120 degrees. These cats were carnivores, which means their diet consisted of animals, such as woolly mammoths, sloths, and other large prey. They became extict 10,000 years ago due to climate change and hunting.

The Woolly Mammoth lived from 1.8 million to 11,000 years ago. They grew up to 11 feet and weighed around 6 tons. Their diet was herbivourous, which means they ate only plant-based foods. Drastic climate change and hunting contributed to the extiction of these animals, although one population was able to survive on Wrangel Island until 4,000 years ago.
Dinosaurs did not like the heat
Florida was underwater when dinosaurs lived
Florida was too far from where dinosaurs lived
Dinosaurs did not live in North America
I am the largest turtle to ever live. I used my large, powerful jaws to crush crustaceans and mollusks. I also lacked a hard shell. Which prehistoric animal am I?

The modern horse has it roots in a dog-sized proto-horse that lived during the prehistoric times. The one-toed horse we know today had ancestors with three or four toes.

My skeleton is made up of almost entirely cartilage. I can grow up to 60 feet and may have produced the strongest bitein the history of the planet, 5 times the bite force of a T. Rex. Which prehistoric animal am I?

I am a cat, but not closely related to tigers, cats, or other modern cats. I have very long fangs used for subduing prey. My jaw can open up to 120 degrees. Which prehistoric animal am I?
